intro: Trianthema americanum, commonly known as the American trianthema, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, and it is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
